research_projects.title: A. Approximate Arithmetic Unit Designs for FPGAs
research_projects.desc: Significant work has been done to achieve efficient implementation of arithmetic units using approximate computing with ASIC technology but these designs when implemented on FPGAs becomes inefficient. Because of architectural difference, the FPGA based design requires different approach to be efficient in terms of area and delay when implemented on FPGA. This project aims to develop efficient arithmetic unit design for FPGAs by using the concept of approximate computing.

research_projects.title: B. Efficient Filter Architectures for Image Processing
research_projects.desc: This project aims to develop efficient filter implementation for image processing applications. It exploits architectural and circuit level techniques to implement filtering algorithm such that they require less implementation area and consume less power while maintain the performance of the implemented filters.

research_projects.title: C. Efficient Digital Circuit Design using Memristors
research_projects.desc: This project aims to develop efficient digital circuits using Memristors. It exploits the properties of Memristors to implement efficient digital designs such as arithmetic units, comparators, and filters such that implemented designs require less implementation area and consume less power while maintain the performance.
